com.camerontec.util.logsreplication.client

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithName
      • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithLogger
        • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithLifeCycle
          • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponent
            • com.camerontec.util.logsreplication.client.jmx.AttributeChangeNotificationSendingComponent
              • com.camerontec.util.logsreplication.client.Logger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoggerEventListener, LoggerMXBean, IHasLifeCycle, IHasName, NotificationBroadcaster, NotificationEmitter, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware

    public class Logger
extends AttributeChangeNotificationSendingComponent
implements LoggerMXBean, LoggerEventListener
    Client side representation of a logger.

    This class represents a logger. It encapsulates a replication server state machine and the logger lifecycle state machine. Received events are passed to these state machines. The logger contains its own operational state and allow clients to mount and unmount. This class is multithread safe.

              String connectionAddress,

              int connectionToken,
              long connectionDelayLimit,
              IExtendedMBeanServer cascadeTargetMBeanServer)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Unique coordinates identifying the logger.
        fileSystemManager - The file system manager handling the local persistence.
        lifecycleStateMachine - The logger lifecycle state machine.
        replicationStateMachine - The replication server state machine.
        fileSystemUtils - A utility class used to retrieve a directory snapshot.
        connectionAddress - The connection address of this logger group.
        connectionPort - The connection port of this logger group.
        connectionToken - Identifies this particular logger instance with the group.
        connectionDelayLimit - Maximum amount of time to wait for an incoming data push connection after a request has been sent.
        cascadeTargetMBeanServer - The cascade target mbean server.

      • handleFileMismatchException

        public void handleFileMismatchException(String filename)
        The replication server has reported that a file is mismatched, i.e. the client requested data from a file position greater than the maximum size of the file at the server. In this case the file at the client needs to be deleted and regenerated from the server. This function will also create a 'directory lock' file in the directory as a way to inform any log players that they should stop reading from this directory.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename that is mismatched.

      • mount

        public void mount()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: LoggerMXBean
        Mount the local logger.

        Persists the local logger in local storage and starts replication from the remote logger if the remote logger has come online.

        Specified by:
        mount in interface LoggerMXBean
        Throws:
        IOException - An IO exception occurred storing the mount value.

      • unmount

        public void unmount()
             throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: LoggerMXBean
        Unmount the local logger.

      • shutdownAndDeleteLogger

        public void shutdownAndDeleteLogger()
                             throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: LoggerMXBean
        Unmount the logger if it is mounted and then delete all local replicated logs and the logger directory. After this operation no other logger operation should be invoked. It is expected this operation is invoked once the server instance in the MIS has been removed.
        Specified by:
        shutdownAndDeleteLogger in interface LoggerMXBean
        Throws:
        IOException - An IOException has been raised while trying to shutdown and delete the logger.

        Returns:
        The logger replication state machine instance.
